text: These are the official results of the Men's 50 km walk event at the 2002 European Championships in Munich, Germany, held on August 8, 2002. Poland's Robert Korzeniowski set a new world record, clocking a total time of 3:36:39, defeating Valeriy Spitsyn's 3:37:26 from May 21, 2000 set in Moscow, Russia. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable" style=" text-align:center; font-size:110%;" width="35%" |- |bgcolor="gold"|Gold|| Robert Korzeniowski Poland (POL) |- |bgcolor="silver"|Silver|| Aleksey Voyevodin Russia (RUS) |- |bgcolor="CC9966"|Bronze|| Jesús Ángel García Spain (ESP) |} ==Abbreviations== *All times shown are in hours:minutes:seconds {| class="wikitable" style=" text-align:center; font-size:110%;" width="35%" |- |DNS || did not start |- |NM || no mark |- |WR || world record |- |WL || world leading |- |AR || area record |- |CR || event record |- |NR || national record |- |PB || personal best |- |SB || season best |} ==Records== {| class="wikitable" style=" text-align:center; font-size:110%;" width="80%" |- !colspan="5"|Standing records prior to the 2002 European Athletics Championships |- | World Record || || 3:37:26 || May 21, 2000 || Moscow, Russia |- | Event Record || || 3:40:55 || August 31, 1986 || Stuttgart, West Germany |- !colspan="5"|Standing records after the 2002 European Athletics Championships |- | World Record ||rowspan=2| ||rowspan=2|3:36:39 ||rowspan=2|August 8, 2002 ||rowspan=2| Munich, Germany |- | Event Record |} ==Intermediates== ==Final== {| class="wikitable" style=" text-align:center;
